trans-unit.source: Remember the following items when you make dynamic changes to jar files or to the classpath.

seg-source.mrk: Remember the following items when you make dynamic changes to jar files or to the classpath.

target.mrk: Remember the following items when you make dynamic changes to jar files or to the classpath.

trans-unit.source: When you are changing the derby.database.classpath property, all classes loaded from database jar files are reloaded, even for a jar file that has not changed.

seg-source.mrk: When you are changing the derby.database.classpath property, all classes loaded from database jar files are reloaded, even for a jar file that has not changed.

target.mrk: When you are changing the derby.database.classpath property, all classes loaded from database jar files are reloaded, even for a jar file that has not changed.

trans-unit.source: Remember that the user's classpath is searched first.

seg-source.mrk: Remember that the user's classpath is searched first.

target.mrk: Remember that the user's classpath is searched first.

trans-unit.source: Any existing prepared statements will use the previously loaded classes unless they require class loading, in which case they will fail with a ClassNotFound error.

seg-source.mrk: Any existing prepared statements will use the previously loaded classes unless they require class loading, in which case they will fail with a ClassNotFound error.

target.mrk: Any existing prepared statements will use the previously loaded classes unless they require class loading, in which case they will fail with a ClassNotFound error.

trans-unit.source: Cached objects do not match objects created with newly loaded classes. For example, an in-memory Customer object will not match a new Customer object if the Customer class has been reloaded, and it will raise a ClassCastException.

seg-source.mrk: Cached objects do not match objects created with newly loaded classes.
For example, an in-memory Customer object will not match a new Customer object if the Customer class has been reloaded, and it will raise a ClassCastException.

target.mrk: Cached objects do not match objects created with newly loaded classes.
For example, an in-memory Customer object will not match a new Customer object if the Customer class has been reloaded, and it will raise a ClassCastException.
